Macro Theme : Global Growth & Economic Cycles

Global Growth & Economic Cycles: metals tailwinds, CoT macro proxies and forward cycle indicators.

As of 2025-12-10

Gemini Summary

Global Growth & Economic Cycles: metals tailwinds, CoT macro proxies and forward cycle indicators.

Executive Summary

The current macro environment reflects a nuanced interplay between resilient cyclical demand and emerging defensive positioning. Industrial and energy-transition metals show underlying strength and positive momentum, supported by a significant metals tailwind. However, precious metals exhibit speculative unwinding and hedging activity, while a sharp deterioration in Rates sector flow momentum signals potential caution or shifting macro expectations.

The overall regime is characterised by continued demand-side support in specific commodities, juxtaposed with indications of risk-off sentiment in more defensive or rate-sensitive markets, suggesting a complex late-cycle or transitionary phase.

  • Gold & Silver CoT: Speculative unwinding in Gold with a recent extreme short position, and defensive hedger positioning in Silver with ongoing long reduction.
  • Industrial & Energy/Transition Metals CoT (Copper, Platinum, Palladium, Lithium): Strong industrial demand signals from Copper and Palladium, characterised by high speculative long positioning and extreme hedger shorting. Platinum shows a mix of speculative long reduction against deep hedger long pressure. Lithium positioning is balanced.
  • Crude Oil CoT: Neutral positioning with sustained long accumulation, indicative of supportive but not aggressively bullish global demand.
  • Metals Tailwind (Copper Residual): Signalling a strong demand tailwind for industrial metals as of June 2025, after adjusting for energy costs and USD movements.
  • Forward Cycle Proxy (Flow Momentum): Improving flow momentum in the broader "Other" (metals/energy) sector, contrasted sharply by deteriorating flows in the "Rates" sector.
  • Overall Bias for Global Growth: Supportive cyclical demand is present but is overlaid with increasing signs of caution and divergent momentum across sectors.

1. Precious Metals as Macro Proxies: Gold & Silver CoT

Gold CoT data as of October 28, 2025, shows speculators are net long at 22.79% of open interest but have significantly reduced long exposure, evidenced by a 4-week flow of -6.63%. Their z-score of -1.72 indicates a notable stretched short position, though not a 1-year extreme at the latest reading, it was flagged as such on October 21. Hedgers maintain a neutral stance with a z-score of -0.41. This configuration implies a fading speculative risk appetite for safe-haven assets, with recent price declines to $3,966.20 coinciding with the speculative unwinding.

Silver CoT indicates a balanced market structure as of October 28, 2025, with speculators net long at 13.84% of open interest and hedgers net short at -14.87%. Hedgers are in a "Hedgers_Deep_Long" pressure regime, reflected by a z-score of 1.73, suggesting they are less net short than typical. This positioning is near a 1-year extreme for hedgers (Hedger_zscore was 2.12 on Oct 21). Recent 4-week flows show a significant long reduction of -7.47% from both sides, while price is at $42.70. The aggregate signal suggests ongoing re-evaluation or defensive positioning in response to price dynamics and macro uncertainty.

2. Industrial & Energy / Transition Metals and Crude Oil CoT

Copper, a key industrial demand proxy, shows speculators stretched long with a z-score of 1.91 and holding 22.79% net open interest as of October 28, 2025. Conversely, hedgers are at a 1-year extreme short with a z-score of -2.49 and -29.95% net open interest, indicating strong underlying industrial demand being met by producer hedging. Despite this tension, 4-week flows remain positive at 1.79%, suggesting continued accumulation. This implies robust global manufacturing and capex-sensitive growth, with a price of $37.4540.

In the cluster of industrial/auto/energy-transition metals, Platinum (speculators net long 16.89%, hedgers net short -19.13%) exhibits a "Hedgers_Deep_Long" regime with a positive hedger z-score of 1.37, indicating they are less short than usual, despite recent long reduction flows of -6.07%. Palladium (speculators net short -7.09%, hedgers net short -16.37%) shows both parties near stretched positions, with a strong 4-week long build of 13.08% for speculators and hedgers in a "Deep_Short" regime, reflecting significant demand-driven short covering. Lithium Hydroxide shows balanced positioning, with no extremes and a 4-week long reduction of -2.20%. Collectively, Copper and Palladium suggest supportive global demand and cyclical strength, particularly in auto and industrial sectors, while Platinum presents a more mixed demand signal and Lithium shows no strong directional conviction.

Crude Oil (WTI) CoT as of October 28, 2025, indicates that both speculators (-1.12% OI) and hedgers (-12.47% OI) are net short. Hedger positioning is neutral (z-score -0.50), while speculative positioning is also neutral (z-score -0.12). The 4-week flow shows a positive Long_Build of 0.28%, suggesting gradual accumulation. With price at $71.39, this configuration is consistent with robust global demand and a normalisation of risk premium rather than extreme supply concerns or demand weakness, reflecting a stable energy market cycle.

3. Energy-Adjusted Metals Tailwind: Industrial Demand Signal

The Energy-Adjusted Metals Tailwind signal, last updated June 30, 2025, is in a "Demand_Tailwind" regime, with a z-score of 1.01. This indicates robust underlying industrial demand for copper after controlling for the influence of WTI crude oil and the broad USD index. A positive residual suggests that copper prices are stronger than what energy costs and dollar strength alone would imply, pointing to genuine demand-side support for industrial activity. This signal is supportive of an expanding global cycle regime, indicating persistent demand strength for base metals.

4. Forward Economic Cycle Proxies: CoT Flow Momentum

CoT flow momentum, as of October 28, 2025, presents divergent signals. The broader "Other" sector, encompassing various metals and energy markets, shows a positive average 4-week flow (0.1859) and an accelerating 4-week momentum (0.3779), suggesting improving overall flow into cyclical assets. However, the breadth of these flows is evenly distributed between positive (44.56%) and negative (46.67%) markets, implying that the positive momentum is not yet broad-based. In contrast, the "Rates" sector exhibits a sharply deteriorating 4-week flow momentum (-1.8400), indicating a significant shift in bond market positioning. This divergence suggests a complex forward cycle, where cyclical assets may see continued, albeit narrowly supported, momentum, while fixed income markets are signalling a potential slowdown or re-pricing of risk.

5. Synthesised Global Growth & Cycle Assessment

The overall market intelligence suggests a global growth environment characterised by resilient, metals-led cyclical demand, but with notable areas of defensive positioning and divergent macro signals. Strong underlying industrial demand for copper (Metals Tailwind) and active accumulation in Copper and Palladium futures indicate continued strength in cyclically sensitive sectors. However, the significant speculative unwinding in Gold and defensive hedging in Silver point to an underlying layer of risk aversion. This tension is further underscored by the mixed picture in flow momentum, where positive shifts in broader commodities are counterbalanced by deteriorating flows in the Rates sector. The regime can be best described as a "Resilient Cyclical Demand with Underlying Growth Support, but Emerging Defensive Overlays and Divergent Flow Momentum."

Component Current Configuration Cycle Interpretation
Gold CoT Speculators net long (22.79% OI), but substantial long reduction (-6.63% flow), z-score -1.72 (stretched short). Price: $3,966.20. Fading speculative risk appetite or safe-haven unwinding, potentially signalling caution in broader markets.
Silver CoT Balanced positioning, hedgers in a "Deep_Long" regime (z-score 1.73, near 1-year extreme), with significant long reduction (-7.47% flow). Price: $42.70. Defensive hedging activity and re-evaluation of industrial demand, indicating underlying market sensitivity.
Industrial Metals CoT (Copper) Speculators stretched long (z-score 1.91), hedgers at 1-year extreme short (z-score -2.49), sustained long build (1.79% flow). Price: $37.4540. Robust industrial demand and capex-sensitive growth, met by active hedging against higher prices.
Energy / Transition Metals CoT (Platinum, Palladium, Lithium) Platinum: Speculators net long, hedgers "Deep_Long" (z-score 1.37) but long reduction (-6.07% flow). Price: $144.68. Palladium: Speculators net short, hedgers net short "Deep_Short" (z-score -1.86), strong long build (13.08% flow). Price: $133.39. Lithium: Balanced positioning, no extremes, neutral hedger pressure, long reduction (-2.20% flow). Strong demand in Palladium (auto/industrial), mixed signals for Platinum, and neutral positioning for Lithium. Highlights selective cyclical strength.
Crude Oil CoT Both speculators and hedgers net short, both z-scores neutral, moderate long build (0.28% flow). Price: $71.39. Consistent with robust global demand and an orderly market, without aggressive bullish or bearish conviction.
Metals Tailwind "Demand_Tailwind" regime (z-score 1.01 as of June 2025). Strong underlying industrial demand for copper, supportive of global cyclical expansion after adjusting for energy and USD.
Cycle Flow Proxies "Other" sector avg_flow_4w_mom is improving (0.3779), while "Rates" sector avg_flow_4w_mom is sharply deteriorating (-1.8400). Divergent momentum signals an improving cyclical outlook for broad commodities contrasted by a cautious or defensive shift in fixed income markets.

6. Forward Risks

Upside (Pro-Growth) Risks

  • Metals tailwind persists or strengthens, particularly if the gap between CoT data and Metals Tailwind signal closes with continued positive momentum.
  • Short-covering or normalisation in Gold/Silver positioning, moving away from defensive stances, that supports broader risk appetite.
  • Flow momentum broadens positively across more metals and energy markets, indicating widespread participation in a cyclical upswing.
  • Crude oil positioning evolves towards a strong net long speculative bias, consistent with robust and accelerating global demand.

Downside (Cycle-Slowdown) Risks

  • Metals tailwind fades or turns into a headwind, signalling weakening underlying industrial demand in copper and other cyclical metals.
  • Persistent or deepening speculative defensiveness in Gold/Silver, coupled with an increase in hedger short positions in industrial metals, suggesting increased macro uncertainty.
  • Flow momentum turns decisively negative across commodity sectors with broad-based de-risking, and the "Rates" sector deterioration persists or worsens.
  • Crude oil CoT shifts towards demand-concern regimes, such as significant net speculative de-risking or aggressive hedger shorting.

7. Investment Interpretation (Informational)

A growth and cycle regime configured with sustained metals-led demand and an ongoing "Demand_Tailwind" typically supports the relative performance of metals and cyclical assets over defensive counterparts. However, the current tension from defensive positioning in precious metals and deteriorating flow momentum in the Rates sector introduces complexity. This environment suggests that macro-sensitive assets may exhibit heightened sensitivity to shifts in speculative positioning and flow dynamics, particularly if existing extreme positions unwind abruptly. Investment concentration could form around metals, energy, and industrial exposures, but the divergence across indicators necessitates careful monitoring of cyclical versus defensive asset rotation and overall market breadth for early signs of regime shifts.
